medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive cognitive decline over 3 months with memory difficulties, myoclonus, and gait imbalance.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 months ago with subacute onset. Initially, the patient experienced memory difficulties, particularly with short-term recall, which progressed to challenges in decision-making and organization. Symptoms worsened to include sudden brief jerking movements, progressive gait imbalance leading to falls, and an inability to perform daily activities. Three months after the onset, the patient could no longer work, drive, or cook.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Celiac disease diagnosed 9 years previously (resolved with a gluten-free diet), collagenous colitis, Raynaud syndrome, osteopenia, anxiety, and prior episodes of hyponatremia related to polydipsia.
medical_history.family_history: Father had myasthenia gravis; no family history of dementia reported.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked as a financial analyst, had never consumed tobacco, and drank 3-4 alcoholic beverages per week.
